events.title: Mobilize | Art Inspiring Activism with Wild & Scenic Film Festival Exhibition
events.description: Mobilize is the first exhibition of 2026 under Art in Public Spaces and celebrates a 15-year partnership between Nevada County Arts Council and Wild & Scenic Film Festival. This year‚Äôs festival theme and title of the Rood Center exhibition, MOBILIZE, serves as a call to action and a celebration of progress toward tangible change. The exhibition explores Wild and Scenic‚Äôs rich history and its visual art exhibition, utilizing visual language to elevate voices, organize efforts, and address environmental challenges.

events.title: Baby Storytime
events.description: Join Miss Emily for Baby Storytime at the historic Grass Valley Library. This short story time is filled with rhymes, songs, and stories for the youngest children and their caregivers. We invite you to linger and enjoy each other's company after the story time. Toys will be provided.

events.title: Baby Storytime
events.description: Looking for a great way to engage with your little ones? Join us for a delightful morning of story and song with Miss Betsey every Tuesday at the Penn Valley Library!

events.title: Just Books Book Club

events.title: Paws to Read
events.description: Practice reading aloud with Raven, the therapy dog! Bring a book from home or choose one from our shelves.

events.title: Lego Club

events.title: African Drum and Dance of Nevada County
events.description: Come join our vibrant African Drum and Dance classes! Open to all ages and abilities, we explore different styles from across the African Diasporic disciplines. Including Malian, Congolese, Guinean, Senegalese, Afro-Cuban and Afro-Brazilian. Masters of their craft travel from all over to share their culture and heritage with our beautiful community, along with our own fabulous local teachers and percussionists, to offer a truly inspiring and engaging experience

events.title: Bard to the Bone
events.description: "Defer no time, delays have dangerous ends.." If you're craving some classics, join us at Bard to the Bone! Each month, we‚Äôll focus on one of William Shakespeare‚Äôs plays and discuss what was interesting, funny, or downright confusing about the text or the adaptations we watched. Whether you‚Äôre a lifelong fan, a critic, or an interested amateur, we‚Äôre excited to have a lively discussion every time. This month, our selection is Henry VI parts 1 & 2!

events.title: Joss Stone
events.description: Wednesday, February 18, 2026, Doors: 6pm | Show: 7pm, The Center for the Arts | 314 W. Main Street, Grass Valley, CA, Tickets: Reserved Seating, Genre: R&B, Joss Stone is a Grammy and Brit Award-winning artist who released her acclaimed debut album, The Soul Sessions, in 2003, at the age of 16. Over her career, she has released ninestudio albums, selling over 15 million copies worldwide. Stone has performed and collaborated with legendary artists including James Brown, BurtBacharach, Stevie Wonder, Gladys Knight, Sting, Van Morrison, Melissa Etheridge, Jeff Beck, Mick Jagger, and Damien Marley, amassing over one billion streams in the US alone.In 2014, she completed her audacious Total World Tour, performing and collaborating withlocal artists and charities in every country in the world.Her 2022 release, Never Forget My Love, was her eighth studio album, written with and produced by Eurythmics‚Äô Dave Stewart, with whom she also co-wrote music and lyrics for the West End musical The Time Traveller‚Äôs Wife. In 2023, Stone embarked on her "20 Years of Soul" anniversary tour, during which she recorded her first live album, 20 Years of Soul - Live in Concert. She followed this with the Ellipsis Tour in 2024. Her latest single, "Loving You," was released on August 9, 2024. Stone is currently working on a new studio album, scheduled for release in 2025.

events.title: Nevada City Winery Gallery "S√ùN" - "VISION" by Lilja Gudmundsdottir
events.description: This series vividly shows reflective water, light, boulders, plant life, banks, and rich colors, but Lilja‚Äôs talents shine in her capturing of the river‚Äôs hidden jeweled views. She does so by literally going knee deep, camera in hand exploring over, under, and around to find the mysteries of immense boulders, crevasses, cracks, or wisps of branches seemingly embracing, and reaching for a softly lit boulder. The shows runs through February 23 - the winery is open every day. www.ncwinery.com.

events.title: Build, Make, Play
events.description: Join us in the Grass Valley Library kid's room and let's have fun creating, building, and learning together. This program is open to all youth, but is best suited for kids ages 8-12.

events.title: Homework Help
events.description: Need a hand with a tricky math problem or a confusing assignment? Truckee Library's Homework Help program is here for you! Friendly volunteers are available to support students in grades K‚Äì12 with schoolwork. Just drop in. No appointment needed!

events.title: Paws to Read
events.description: Practice reading aloud trained dog, Inky or Mojo! Color a bookmark, collect a sticker each time you visit a dog, and after five stickers choose a book to keep!

events.title: LEGO Club
events.description: Join us for building adventures with our LEGO Club at Penn Valley Library! Let your imagination run wild with your designs. Remember to take a photo of your creations, as the LEGOS live at the library and must stay in the children's room. All ages welcome, though some LEGOs are not suited for babies and toddlers.

events.title: Lawyer in the Library- Truckee
events.description: Get free legal help from an attorney every month at the Truckee Library Workspace, 10879 Donner Pass Rd. in Truckee. Sign-up for a free 15-minute legal consultation with a local volunteer attorney through our online calendar or by calling (530) 582-7846. The Lawyer in the Library program is ideal for self-represented litigants in need of general legal guidance. Lawyer in the Library will provide help with criminal, trust/estate, and general legal matters. Lawyer in the Library is designed to hel

events.title: Art Club
events.description: Looking to infuse your week with a burst of creativity? Join the Grass Valley Adult Art Club! Each week, we‚Äôll explore a new project designed to spark your imagination and offer your mind a refreshing escape through an hour of hands-on creation. All materials are provided, and artists of every skill level are welcome to join. February Schedule: 2/4 Doodle Hearts 2/11 Vintage Valentines 2/18 Paper Horses 2/25 Painted Hearts

events.title: Queer Reads Book Club
events.description: Queer Reads is a monthly adult book club (18 ) celebrating the diverse voices of queer authors, characters, stories and joy. Join us each month as we celebrate queer storytelling and foster the discovery of new ideas and unfamiliar lived-experiences. Copies of the next month's book are available on a first-come first-served basis at all Queer Reads meetings and at the Nevada County Library. January 21st- Freshwater, by Akwaeke Emezi February 18th- Harriet Tubman Live in Concert, by Bob the Drag

events.title: Qigong
events.description: Use breathing techniques, gentle movement, and meditation to cleanse, strengthen, and circulate your life energy (qi), Qigong promotes health and vitality and a tranquil state that we call a ‚ÄúQigong state of mind.‚Äù These sessions provide a practical, easy-to-follow, daily ritual to self-healing, presented by Connecting Point & Nevada County Library.

events.title: Toddler Storytime
events.description: Stories, songs, and rhymes for babies, toddlers, and little learners ages 0 - 4. Story time is 20 - 30 minutes long and includes scarves or egg shakers and interactive songs and games. After storytime, enjoy the library play space and art corner!

events.title: Preschool Storytime
events.description: Join us for stories, songs and rhymes. It is a great way to build early literacy, creativity and social skills. √önete con nosotros para cuentos, cantos y rimas. Es una manera buena para desarrollar alfabetizaci√≥n temprana, creatividad, y habilidades sociales.

events.title: Family Storytime
events.description: Family Story Time at Grass Valley Library, every Thursday at 11 am Children of all ages are welcome; content geared toward ages 1 to 5 years. After storytime, we invite you to visit with other caregivers and parents in the storytime space. Welcome to all! We look forward to reading & singing with you!

events.title: The Doo-Wop Project
events.description: The Doo Wop Project brings the classic sounds of vocal harmony into the 21st century. Featuring stars from Broadway hits like Jersey Boys, Motown, and Beautiful, this supergroup takes audiences on a journey from the golden age of street-corner harmonies to modern hits ‚ÄúDoo Wopified‚Äù with their signature style. With a PBS special, four albums, and sold-out shows worldwide, The Doo Wop Project delights every generation with music that‚Äôs timeless and fresh.

events.title: Tech Talk: Introduction to Social Media
events.description: Join us and our Resident Tech Expert Mike B. as we delve into all things social media? What to learn what all the fuss is about TikTok or Instagram? Curious about the differences between X and Threads? Are there so many social media platforms out there and friends who want you to join that you just feel like you don't know where to start? Never fear, the library is here! Join us on Thursday, February 19th, from 2PM to 4PM as we talk about tech!

D&D is easy to learn and a blast to play. Come with friends and our Dungeon Masters will start a new campaign just for you! Our D&D club features miniatures, terrain, dice for all, and plenty of player guides. Just show up with your mind tuned to adventure and you'll be in the right place. events.venue_address: Gene Albaugh Community Room, Madelyn Helling Library

events.title: Book Club 217
events.description: Is that a chill creeping through the air‚Ä¶ or is it just time for Book Club 217? Join Crystal, your Ghost Host, for a lively discussion of all things horror and speculative fiction. We meet monthly at The Cauldron ‚Äî upstairs at 107 W. Main Street in Grass Valley. Grab this month‚Äôs pick and bring a friend ‚Äî because there‚Äôs safety in numbers.
events.venue_address: Downtown Grass Valley, Grass Valley Library

events.title: Needle Felting Creations: Mingle & Make
events.description: Mingle & Make ‚Äì Needle Felting Creations, Unwind, get creative, and enjoy a relaxed evening of making at our Mingle & Make: Needle Felting Creations class! Whether you‚Äôre brand new to needle felting or a seasoned crafter, this social, hands-on workshop invites you to explore color, texture, and form while creating your own whimsical felted project to take home., Come solo or bring a friend to share the fun‚Äîsnacks and beverages included! Bring a friend and receive a $5 off coupon toward your next class., Price: $35 + $10 materials fee per person, No experience necessary, Class 6 minimum/11 maximum participants ‚Äì (please note: if attendance does not meet minimum, class will be rescheduled)

events.title: Motion Theater
events.description: With Minica Farbiarz and Evan Specter. We have decades of exploration as performers, teachers of autobiographical, physical, embodied storytelling.

events.title: NU Dance 25th Annual Student Choreography Showcase
events.description: Nevada Union High School‚Äôs Theatrical Dance program proudly presents the 25th annual Student Choreography Showcase on Thursday, February 19th through Saturday, February 21st at 7:00 p.m. at the Don Baggett Theater, 11761 Ridge Road, Grass Valley. Twenty student choreographers have created dances in a variety of styles, taught to their peers in after-school and weekend rehearsals. Junior Tabby Gillespie is choreographing for the first time this year, and she chose ‚ÄúBenny and the Jets‚Äù by Elton John. Reflecting on her song choice, Gillespie said, ‚ÄúI want to share a positive vibe with the audience, conveying that dance doesn‚Äôt need to be taken so seriously. I wanted to choreograph this piece because dance has always been a place where I can be myself and has shaped me as a person.‚Äù Senior Eryn Miller has been in the Advanced Dance class for all four years of high school, and this is her third year choreographing for Showcase. This year, she is choreographing two dances: one for the intermediate class and one for a group of her advanced peers. Her advanced piece is a tribute to her grandmother, who passed away a few years ago. She titled her piece, ‚ÄúFor Grammy,‚Äù explaining, ‚ÄúI will forever know the love she felt for my dancing and the pride she felt when I stepped on stage. I dance not just for myself, but to feel the everlasting love she had for my dance. I know she would be proud of the young dancer I am becoming. I want to honor her memory and give thanks to who she was.‚Äù Junior Charlotte des Tombe composed an original song for her dance, combining her love for dance as well as songwriting. Her piece explores the theme of coping with loss, and she titled her song as well as her dance ‚ÄúBlue Eyes.‚Äù Senior Advanced Dancer and Theatrical Dance Club President, Annie Armstrong, choreographed two dances for this show: one for a Beginning Dance class, and one for Advanced. Both of her dances reflect her transition from childhood to adulthood and her experiences over the past four years in the NU Dance Program. In her choreography proposal, Armstrong wrote, ‚ÄúThis program has been like a home to me, and I am grateful for my friends and the connections I have made here.‚Äù This annual production is an audience favorite. It began as a senior project twenty-four years ago, when current dance teacher, Courtney Wadman, was a senior in the advanced dance class. Wadman, along with some of her fellow dancers, wanted to create a production of student works, so under the guidance of their teacher Yelena Holt, the Student Choreography Showcase became an annual tradition. Tickets are $15 and all seating is reserved. Tickets can be purchased online at www.nevadauniondance.com‚Ä¶. Online sales close at 10:00 a.m. the morning of the performance to prepare the box office. Remaining tickets will be sold at the box office, cash or check only, beginning 2 hours before each performance. For additional information, contact the Nevada Union Dance Department at (530) 273-4431 ext. 2103 or email nuhsdance@gmail.com.

For additional information, contact the Nevada Union Dance Department at (530) 273-4431 ext. 2103 or email nuhsdance@gmail.com.

events.title: Nature Infused Bookmaking Journey
events.description: Handcrafted Journals & Storybooks Using Natural Materials and Time-Honored Binding Techniques, Slow down, work with your hands, and create something meaningful., In this multi-session workshop, participants will explore the art of handmade bookmaking using fine art paper, handmade papers, natural materials, fabric, leather, collage, and traditional binding techniques. We‚Äôll begin with small, playful book forms, move into nature-inspired bindings, and culminate in a beautifully stitched Artist Journal or Artist Storybook., This workshop blends artisan craft with gentle guided creative exploration, offering a welcoming space to quiet the mind through introspection and hands-on making. Books become containers for story, memory, and creative intention ‚Äî pieces you can continue working in long after the class ends., No previous bookbinding experience is required. All materials are provided., What you‚Äôll create:, 2‚Äì3 small handmade books using folded and pre-bound structures, 1‚Äì2 nature-inspired bound books, A final Artist Journal or Artist Storybook using sewn binding techniques, Format:, 4‚Äìsession series | 3 hours per session, Class Size: 6‚Äì10 participants, Session Fee: $245 + Materials Fee: $45

events.title: Nature Infused Bookmaking Journey
events.description: Handcrafted Journals & Storybooks Using Natural Materials and Time-Honored Binding Techniques, Slow down, work with your hands, and create something meaningful., In this multi-session workshop, participants will explore the art of handmade bookmaking using fine art paper, handmade papers, natural materials, fabric, leather, collage, and traditional binding techniques. We‚Äôll begin with small, playful book forms, move into nature-inspired bindings, and culminate in a beautifully stitched Artist Journal or Artist Storybook., This workshop blends artisan craft with gentle guided creative exploration, offering a welcoming space to quiet the mind through introspection and hands-on making. Books become containers for story, memory, and creative intention ‚Äî pieces you can continue working in long after the class ends., No previous bookbinding experience is required. All materials are provided., What you‚Äôll create:, 2‚Äì3 small handmade books using folded and pre-bound structures, 1‚Äì2 nature-inspired bound books, A final Artist Journal or Artist Storybook using sewn binding techniques, Format:, 4‚Äìsession series | 3 hours per session, Class Size: 6‚Äì10 participants, Session Fee: $245 + Materials Fee: $45

events.title: Flameworking Everything Marbles
events.description: Lampworking: Everything Marbles!, Small spheres. Big satisfaction., Are the kids still playing marbles and jacks? Maybe‚Ä¶ maybe not‚Äîbut in this class, marbles take center stage. Everything Marbles! is a playful, hands-on lampworking workshop where participants of all ages and experience levels learn the fundamentals of making beautiful, handmade glass marbles on the torch., This class is all about building strong foundations while having fun. You‚Äôll explore how molten glass gathers, moves, and responds to heat and gravity as you shape, color, and finish your own unique marbles. Along the way, we‚Äôll also demystify the annealing process and why it‚Äôs essential to creating strong, finished glass pieces., Whether you‚Äôre brand new to lampworking or looking to expand your skills, this class offers a welcoming entry point into torchwork‚Äîand a great way to start (or grow) a marble collection made entirely by you., What You‚Äôll Create, Clear glass marbles, Outside-color marbles, Inside-color marbles, What You‚Äôll Learn, Basic heat control on the torch, Gathering and shaping molten glass, Applying color inside and outside the marble, Gravity and marvering techniques, How to use a marble mold, An introduction to annealing and the cooling process, Class Details, Skill Level: All levels welcome (no prior experience required), Format: One hands-on workshop, Ages: Adults & Teens 12 +, Class Size: Small-group instruction for personalized guidance, Materials: All glass and tools provided, Please wear natural fiber clothing (cotton, wool, etc.), Bring a snack and water for break time, Price: $75 class fee + $30 materials, Perfect for curious beginners, young makers, and anyone who loves small-scale glass magic, Everything Marbles! is a fun, approachable way to experience lampworking while creating timeless glass treasures‚Äîone marble at a time.

events.title: Kathleen Edwards
events.description: Kathleen Edwards is a powerhouse of alt-country and Americana - wry, soulful, and unflinchingly real. Known for her sharp lyrics and heartfelt delivery, she‚Äôs been praised by The New York Times for her ‚Äúdroll, observant and unsparing tone,‚Äù and hailed by Rolling Stone as ‚Äúdevastatingly great.‚Äù, On stage, Edwards channels the grit of Lucinda Williams, the candor of Brandi Carlile, and the poetic edge of Jason Isbell. With multiple JUNO and Americana Award nominations and the SOCAN Songwriting Prize to her name, she‚Äôs a storyteller whose songs hit deep - intimate, raw, and irresistibly alive.

events.title: Mobilize | Art Inspiring Activism with Wild & Scenic Film Festival Exhibition
events.description: Mobilize is the first exhibition of 2026 under Art in Public Spaces and celebrates a 15-year partnership between Nevada County Arts Council and Wild & Scenic Film Festival. This year‚Äôs festival theme and title of the Rood Center exhibition, MOBILIZE, serves as a call to action and a celebration of progress toward tangible change. The exhibition explores Wild and Scenic‚Äôs rich history and its visual art exhibition, utilizing visual language to elevate voices, organize efforts, and address environmental challenges.

events.title: Ukulele for the People
events.description: Cool Hand Uke‚Äôs Strum Bums Ukulele Extravaganza Rescue and Relief Band, known simply as the Strum Bums, began in 2000 as a weekly class at the Senior Center when it was located at the Nevada County Fairgrounds. Twenty or so seniors showed up for the first class. Fifteen or so continued. Today there are nearly 75 members on its email list. Join the Strum Bums on Mondays from 3:00pm-4:30pm at the Madelyn Helling Library to get your Ukulele chops ready for showtime! Local Ukulele Legend Dan Scanlan

events.title: Youth Maker XD Ceramics Handbuilding Fun ‚Äì Afterschool Workshop
events.description: Youth Maker XD Ceramics Handbuilding Fun ‚Äì with Candace Tkachenko, Come play with clay!, In this fun and interactive class, students will create ceramic pottery using clay and their imagination! Handbuilding allows participants to learn how to press decorative designs into clay for unique one of kind pottery pieces. Student will learn to to roll clay on the slab roller, design, cut, and decorate their piece with a variety of textures. Pieces will be bisque fired and then the glazing fun begins., You will be notified to pick you your child‚Äôs ceramic pieces after they have been glaze fired, approximately 10 days after the last class., Our classes are designed to be both fun and educational, with experienced instructors who are passionate about sharing their skills and knowledge with young people. We take great care to create a welcoming and inclusive environment where every child can feel valued and supported., Ages 8 +, 4 class series ‚Äì 4:00 ‚Äì 5:30 pm each Monday Afternoon, $150 ($120 + $30 materials), Class 5 minimum/6 maximum participants

events.title: Playwriting Group
events.description: Sent upon request. (We meet in each other's homes.) All playwrights welcome! Whether playwriting is new to you or you're already an accomplished playwright, come join this on-going bi-weekly writers' group. We'll spend our time focusing on our writing, but with that magical element of doing so within the presence of others. Come discover the amazing experience of writing within the context of a group. Bring your computer, notebook, iPad, or whatever you like to use for writing. We share resources, discuss our goals and challenges, even provide feedback, but the primary focus of the group is to work on your own play! We'll do a check-in/discussion at the beginning of the meeting, then write in silence, and check-out at the end of our session. Contact Kimberly for the location and to answer any questions you may have.

events.title: Enameling Jewelry Pendants ‚Äì Mingle and Make
events.description: Mingle and Make ‚ÄìEnameling Jewelry Pendants, Price: $40 plus $20 materials per person, Bring a friend and receive a $5 off coupon toward your next class!, Join us for an evening of fun creating an enameled pendant. Using torches and colored glass powders, we will apply the enamel to copper forms and heat them until the enamels fuse to the copper. We will also be texturing another layer of the pendant with hammers or punches, and using that as a background to the enamel. This is an opportunity to see how colors work together on metal, socialize and share snacks and drinks, and come away with a beautiful and unique pendant that you have made!, Whether you‚Äôre a seasoned artist or a complete beginner, this class is perfect for anyone looking to explore their artistic side and create something truly special., So, grab a friend or come solo for a fun-filled evening of mingling, and creating, not to mention enjoying a few snacks and beverages too!, Min: 8 / Max: 12 participants (please note: if attendance does not meet the minimum, this class will be rescheduled), What is Mingle and Make?, Mingle and Make events are for adults. Join us once a month for drinks and creativity! Meet new people, and make new friends, in a casual setting as you create your own personal masterpiece. Each class will feature a unique DIY project from fusing glass, forging rings, sculpting clay, and more! Tickets include instruction, a guided activity, and supplies plus a complimentary drink. No prior experience is needed., Funds for our Mingle and Make Program are provided through the County of Nevada‚Äôs American Rescue Plan Act allocation for Community & Economic Resiliency.

events.title: Custom Hat Making
events.description: Step into the timeless craft of millinery in this immersive two-day Custom Hat Making workshop. From your first block to the final stitch, you‚Äôll transform high-quality rabbit felt into a beautifully finished, wearable hat that reflects your personal style. Whether your aesthetic is classic, bold, or whimsical, this hands-on experience invites you to slow down, work with intention, and create a piece you‚Äôll treasure for years to come., No prior experience is needed‚Äîthis beginner-friendly class is designed to guide you through the entire process in a supportive, creative environment., What You Will Learn:, Hat blocking and shaping techniques, Essential millinery tools and skills, Hand sewing and interior lining, Hat trimming and decorative finishes, Fabric manipulation and design customization, Materials & Supplies:, All materials are provided, including rabbit felt and lining, Participants are encouraged to bring any special fabrics, trims, ribbons, or beads they might want to incorporate into their hat design, Class Details:, Dates: Friday & Saturday, 2/28 and 3/1, Time: 11:00 AM ‚Äì 6:00 PM each day, Breaktime: 2:00 ‚Äì 3:00 PM daily., Please bring a bag lunch, snack, and beverage (there are no food services near The Forge) , Skill Level: Beginner / No experience required, Ages: 16 and up, Price: $336 + $100 materials fee, Minimum 5 participants/Maximum 10 participants., Come enjoy a relaxed, creative environment while learning a traditional craft and leaving with a stunning, handmade hat that‚Äôs uniquely yours.

events.title: Woodturning 101 ‚Äì Craft a Beautiful Wooden Bowl
events.description: Discover the art of woodturning and learn to make a beautiful wood bowl using a wood lathe ‚Äì no experience is required!, Are you interested in woodturning and looking to learn a new skill? In this class, you‚Äôll learn how to turn a beautiful bowl out of wood using a lathe. The process is both rewarding and relaxing, as you take a piece of raw wood and turn it into a functional work of wood art. Under the guidance of our experienced instructor, you‚Äôll start by learning the basics of wood lathe operation and safety. Once you‚Äôre comfortable with the equipment, we‚Äôll move on to selecting and preparing the wood for turning. With the wood secured on the lathe, you‚Äôll use a series of specially designed tools to shape the bowl. , At the end of the class, you‚Äôll take home a beautiful, hand-turned bowl that you can be proud of. You‚Äôll also have the woodturning skills and knowledge to continue turning bowls on your own. , Price: $160 + $40 materials, Limited spaces available. Sign up today! Class 2 minimum/3 maximum participants ‚Äì (please note: if attendance does not meet minimum, class will be rescheduled) , Tools provided. If you have tools, please feel free to bring them.

events.title: Nevada City Chinese Lunar New Year Parade and Festival
events.venue_name: Commercial Street in Nevada City and at the Miners Foundry.
events.description: The community parade begins at 12:00 noon from the bottom of the Chinese Quarter on Commercial Street (Robinson Plaza) in Nevada City, where revelers may line up. After the Lion Dancing outdoor performance on Spring Street, more entertainment, exhibits, and fun will take place inside the Miners Foundry beginning at 1:00 p.m. Free admission. We thank the Miners Foundry, the Nevada City Chamber of Commerce, the City of Nevada City, and the Nevada City Arts Council for their collaboration., Our parade Grand Marshals are Susan Levitz and Pascale Fusshoeller, founders of YubaNet.com, who have been staunch supporters of CATS and a great asset and news source to the community. , Parade units include the audience favorite -- Chinese ceremonial Lion Dancers and a 72‚Äô Chinese Dragon from Eastern Ways Martial Arts of Sacramento -- second and third graders from Bell Hill Academy, ‚ÄúMulan,‚Äù (aka Lily Emmolo), members of Grass Valley Aikikai martial arts, theatre groups, and other community entries. Food vendors at the Miners Foundry are Kaliko‚Äôs Hawaiian Kitchen and Gold Rush Cookies. There will be Asian-themed arts and crafts and gifts for sale, a kid‚Äôs table, mahjong, a new children‚Äôs Chinese New Year book launch and sale by Allison Chan, face painting with Chinese horoscope tattoos, Chinese tea ceremony demonstrations, Rose Murphy from the Nevada County Historical Society promoting free self-guided historic walking tours of the Grass Valley and Nevada City Chinatowns, Lisa Redfern and Rose Murphy showing their film, "Chinese Family Stories - From Exclusion to Pillars of the Community," community vendors and more. We are seeking parade entries, entertainers, vendors, exhibitors, sponsors, and lots of volunteers. Contact Jeannie Wood at info@catsweb.org

events.title: Ceramics 101 ‚Äì Mud Therapy
events.description: Join us at The Curious Forge for Sunday Ceramics with Bob Davis!, 3-class sessions , Discover the joy of working with clay in this immersive 3 class session workshop at The Curious Forge! Whether you‚Äôre brand new to ceramics or looking to expand your skills, this class with instructor Bob Davis is designed to give you a well-rounded understanding of this dynamic medium., You‚Äôll explore a variety of techniques, including:, Potter‚Äôs Wheel ‚Äì Learn the fundamentals of throwing and shaping clay., Hand-Building ‚Äì Create unique forms using slabs, coils, and extruders., Surface Design & Embellishment ‚Äì Experiment with textures, patterns, and finishing techniques., Throughout the course, you‚Äôll craft a variety of functional and decorative pieces‚Äîchoose from sushi plates, tapas servers, cups, spoon rests, succulent planters, and more! By the end of the series, you‚Äôll gain confidence in your skills and discover which techniques inspire you most., No experience? No problem! This class is open to all levels, from total beginners to those looking to refine their craft., Ages: 15 ‚Äì Adult, Price: $162 + $30 materials, Total Class Time: Three 3-hour Classes = 9 hours, Note: Your Glazed pieces will be ready for pick up 7-10 days after they have been fired, or you can opt for the convenience of having your masterpiece shipped to you for a small shipping and handling fee., Join us for a hands-on creative journey and take home your own handmade ceramics!, All supplies provided, Class 4 minimum/8 maximum participants ‚Äì (please note: if attendance does not meet minimum, class will be rescheduled)

events.title: Three Times Through at the Grass Valley Brewing Co.
events.description: Three Times Through live at the Grass Valley Brewing Co. for Celtic Sunday. 1st Sunday of every month. People ask us, ‚ÄúWhat is that instrument? And did you just mash-up a Rolling Stones song with an Irish jig?‚Äù Playing unique instruments, we are a kinda Celtic quartet re-imagining and blending traditional tunes with modern music. Come curious, leave refreshed!

events.title: North by Northwest (1959)
events.description: NORTH BY NORTHWEST finds New York City ad executive Roger O. Thornhill (Cary Grant) pursued by ruthless spy Phillip Vandamm (James Mason) after Thornhill is mistaken for a government agent. Hunted relentlessly by Vandamm's associates, the harried Thornhill ends up on a cross-country journey, meeting the beautiful and mysterious Eve Kendall (Eva Marie Saint) along the way. Soon Vandamm's henchmen close in on Thornhill, resulting in some of the most iconic action sequences of all time.

events.title: Mobilize | Art Inspiring Activism with Wild & Scenic Film Festival Exhibition
events.description: Mobilize is the first exhibition of 2026 under Art in Public Spaces and celebrates a 15-year partnership between Nevada County Arts Council and Wild & Scenic Film Festival. This year‚Äôs festival theme and title of the Rood Center exhibition, MOBILIZE, serves as a call to action and a celebration of progress toward tangible change. The exhibition explores Wild and Scenic‚Äôs rich history and its visual art exhibition, utilizing visual language to elevate voices, organize efforts, and address environmental challenges.

events.title: Ukulele for the People
events.description: Cool Hand Uke‚Äôs Strum Bums Ukulele Extravaganza Rescue and Relief Band, known simply as the Strum Bums, began in 2000 as a weekly class at the Senior Center when it was located at the Nevada County Fairgrounds. Twenty or so seniors showed up for the first class. Fifteen or so continued. Today there are nearly 75 members on its email list. Join the Strum Bums on Mondays from 3:00pm-4:30pm at the Madelyn Helling Library to get your Ukulele chops ready for showtime! Local Ukulele Legend Dan Scanlan

events.title: Glassblowing for Beginners ‚Äì Make a Paperweight
events.description: Glassblowing for Beginners Level 1 ‚Äì An introduction to Glassblowing, Experience the enchanting art of glassblowing and transform molten glass into a stunning physical creation in just 3 hours! This beginner-friendly class is designed to introduce you to the fundamentals of glassblowing and let you unleash your creativity., Starting with a brief safety and tool identification talk, we‚Äôll quickly move on to the exciting part ‚Äì working with hot glass! You‚Äôll have the opportunity to gather glass, manipulate it with fire and tools, and shape it into a beautiful work of art. Under the guidance of our experienced glassblower, you‚Äôll create a one-of-a-kind colored glass paperweight that you can proudly display in your home or office. This hands-on class will allow you to experience the magic of glassblowing while learning a new skill that you can continue to develop. Don‚Äôt miss out on this unique opportunity to explore the ancient art of glassblowing and create a beautiful piece of art to take home!, Your stunning glass creations will be ready for pickup at The Forge within a few days of your class, or you can opt for the convenience of having your masterpiece shipped to you for a small shipping and handling fee., Disclaimer: Occasionally, hot glass may break during the annealing process. If your glass piece breaks, you will have the option to select a similar replacement piece from our stock of handblown glass items., Ages 14+, Price: $180, Class minimum 2 students/maximum 4 students. If the class minimum is not met, the class will be rescheduled to a later date.

events.title: Nevada City Odd Fellows Open Mic
events.description: The most relaxed, most welcoming open mic in Western Nevada County
